chapters.name: What Is Synthetic Media?
topics: What does the term 'synthetic media' mean — and how does it differ from edited, manipulated, or simply misleading content?
What are the main categories of synthetic media: text, image, audio, video — and how are they produced?
Why has synthetic media become dramatically easier and cheaper to produce in recent years?
How does synthetic media differ from traditional propaganda, photoshopping, or selective editing?
What is the difference between AI-generated content that is disclosed and content designed to deceive?
Why does the existence of synthetic media undermine trust even when a specific piece of content is real?
What role does intent play in determining whether synthetic media is harmful — and is intent always detectable?

chapters.name: How AI Generates Text
topics: How do large language models like ChatGPT produce human-sounding text — and what are they actually doing?
Why is AI-generated text so convincing — what makes it hard to distinguish from human writing?
How is AI-generated text used to create fake news articles, fake reviews, and fake social media posts at scale?
What is the difference between AI writing a draft for a human editor and AI writing autonomously to deceive?
How do content farms and SEO operations use AI-generated text to flood search results and social feeds?
What happens when AI-generated text is used to impersonate real people — in emails, messages, or public statements?
Why do AI text generators sometimes produce false information that reads as completely authoritative?
How can you evaluate whether a piece of text was likely generated by AI — and what are the limits of detection?

chapters.name: How AI Generates Images and Video
topics: How do AI image generators like Midjourney and DALL-E create realistic images from text descriptions?
What are deepfake videos — how are they made, and how convincing have they become?
How have AI-generated images been used to create fake evidence of events that never happened?
What is the difference between AI-generated images used for art or illustration and those used for deception?
How are AI-generated images of real people used for harassment, fraud, and political manipulation?
Why is video more dangerous than still images — and how is AI-generated video improving?
What are the tell-tale artifacts in AI-generated images — hands, text, backgrounds, lighting — and are they disappearing?
How does the speed of AI image generation make debunking slower than creation?

chapters.name: How AI Generates and Clones Audio
topics: How does AI voice cloning work — and how little source audio does it need to replicate someone's voice?
How have cloned voices been used in scams, fraud, and impersonation of public figures?
What are the implications of AI-generated audio for phone calls, voicemails, and audio evidence?
How is AI-generated audio used in political disinformation — fake speeches, fake phone calls, fake endorsements?
What is the difference between AI-generated audio used for accessibility and entertainment versus deception?
How can you verify whether an audio clip is authentic — and what tools exist to help?
Why is audio deepfake detection harder than image deepfake detection?

chapters.name: Tell-Tale Signs of AI-Generated Content
topics: What visual artifacts reveal that an image was likely generated by AI — and how quickly are these artifacts improving?
What linguistic patterns suggest that a piece of text was written by a large language model?
How do metadata, file properties, and provenance information help identify synthetic content?
What are AI detection tools — how do they work, what are their accuracy rates, and what are their limitations?
Why does the arms race between generation and detection mean that today's detection methods may not work tomorrow?
How does context — source, timing, distribution pattern — matter more than pixel-level analysis?
What is the role of critical thinking and common sense when technical detection fails?
How can you build a personal verification workflow for suspicious content you encounter online?

chapters.name: Bot Networks and Engagement Farms
topics: What are bot networks — how are they built, and what do they do on social media platforms?
How do engagement farms use real humans and automated accounts to manufacture the appearance of consensus?
What is the difference between a bot, a troll, a sock puppet, and a coordinated inauthentic behavior campaign?
How do bot networks amplify specific narratives — making fringe ideas appear mainstream?
How have state-sponsored bot networks been used to interfere in elections and destabilize democracies?
What are the economic incentives behind bot networks — who pays for them and why?
How do platforms detect and remove bot networks — and why is it so difficult to stay ahead?
How can an ordinary user identify bot-like behavior in their social media feeds?

chapters.name: Astroturfing and Manufactured Consensus
topics: What is astroturfing — and how does it create the illusion of grassroots support for positions that lack it?
How do organizations, governments, and political campaigns use astroturfing to shape public opinion?
What is the relationship between astroturfing and AI — how does AI make manufactured consensus cheaper and faster?
How does astroturfing work on different platforms — Twitter/X, Facebook, Reddit, TikTok, YouTube comments?
What are the psychological effects of seeing widespread (but fake) agreement with a position?
How does astroturfing undermine genuine public discourse and democratic decision-making?
What are the signs that a campaign, petition, or movement may be astroturfed rather than organic?
How does the combination of bot networks, AI-generated content, and astroturfing create a full-spectrum manipulation system?

chapters.name: Political Manipulation and Election Interference
topics: How has synthetic media been used to interfere with elections — in the US and around the world?
What are the specific risks of deepfake video or audio of political candidates released close to Election Day?
How do AI-generated fake news articles and social media posts target voters in swing states or contested races?
What is the role of micro-targeting — using AI to deliver different synthetic messages to different audiences?
How do foreign governments use synthetic media as a tool of information warfare against democracies?
What have election officials, platforms, and governments done to prepare for AI-powered election interference?
Why is the speed of synthetic media production a fundamental challenge for democratic processes that rely on informed voters?

chapters.name: The Trust Crisis: When Nothing Looks Real
topics: What is the 'liar's dividend' — how does the existence of deepfakes allow real evidence to be dismissed as fake?
How does widespread synthetic media erode public trust in journalism, photography, video evidence, and audio recordings?
What happens to legal proceedings, journalism, and accountability when any piece of media can be claimed to be AI-generated?
How does the trust crisis affect different communities differently — who is most vulnerable to manipulation and who benefits from doubt?
What is the relationship between media literacy, institutional trust, and resilience to synthetic media?
How does the trust crisis interact with existing polarization — making it harder for people to agree on basic facts?
What would it take to rebuild trust in media and information in an era of ubiquitous AI generation?

chapters.name: Tools and Techniques for Verification
topics: What free and accessible tools exist for checking whether an image has been AI-generated or manipulated?
How do reverse image searches, metadata viewers, and provenance trackers help verify content?
What is C2PA (Coalition for Content Provenance and Authenticity) — and how does content authentication work?
How can you verify the source and distribution path of a viral video or audio clip?
What role do professional fact-checking organizations play — and how can citizens use their work?
How do you evaluate a claim when you can't verify the media directly — using context, sourcing, and reasoning?
What is a practical step-by-step verification workflow that any internet user can follow?
Why is verification a skill that requires practice — and what habits make someone more resistant to synthetic manipulation?

chapters.name: Legal, Regulatory, and Platform Responses
topics: What laws exist — or are being proposed — to address deepfakes, synthetic media, and AI-generated disinformation?
How do social media platforms currently handle synthetic media — labeling, removal, or demotion?
What is the debate over requiring AI-generated content to be labeled or watermarked?
How do different countries approach the regulation of synthetic media — the EU, US, China, and others?
What are the free speech implications of regulating AI-generated content — and where are the legal boundaries?
Why is enforcement of synthetic media laws so difficult across international borders and anonymous accounts?
What role should technology companies play in self-regulation — and what happens when they fail?

chapters.name: Living in a World of Synthetic Content
topics: How do you develop personal resilience against synthetic media without becoming cynical about all information?
What habits of mind — slowing down, checking sources, considering motivation — protect against manipulation?
How do you talk to family, friends, and community members about synthetic media without causing panic?
What is the role of media literacy education in schools — and is it keeping up with the technology?
How do you balance awareness of synthetic media threats with the ability to function as an informed citizen?
What does responsible sharing look like in an era when the content you amplify may be synthetic?
How do communities, newsrooms, and civic organizations build collective resilience against synthetic manipulation?
What does the future of information look like — and what can individuals do now to prepare?
